intro: Podospermum angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf podo, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in spring. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
